Read More See Publications See all experts About BPC Who We Are Magazine Leadership Experts Staff Careers Internships Privacy Policy Events Upcoming Events Past Events Research Reports Blog Data and Resources Infographics Letters and Testimony Special Initiatives American Energy Innovation Council CEO Council on Health and Innovation Executive Council on Infrastructure Contact Media Center Subscribe Contact Us Support Us Senior Policy Analyst, Health Project: Data Analysis Wednesday, April 13, 2016 The Bipartisan Policy Center is a non-profit organization that combines the best ideas from both parties to promote health, security, and opportunity for all Americans. BPC drives principled and politically viable policy solutions through the power of rigorous analysis, painstaking negotiation, and aggressive advocacy. As the only Washington, DC-based think tank that actively promotes bipartisanship, BPC works to address the key challenges facing the nation. Our policy solutions are the product of informed deliberations by former elected and appointed officials, business and labor leaders, and academics and advocates who represent both ends of the political spectrum. We are currently focused on health care, energy, national security, housing, immigration, and the economy. BPC is currently seeking a senior policy analyst to specialize in health care data analysis for the organization’s Health Project. Responsibilities include a variety of tasks in an often fast-paced environment, which requires teamwork and a willingness to assist co-workers in the full range of project activities. The successful candidate will be expected to learn quickly on the job and will have the opportunity to interact and engage with experienced health policy leaders. As part of a growing think tank, the policy analyst will also be challenged to think creatively about non-policy issues such as project direction, strategy, and bipartisanship. Responsibilities Research and analyze federal and state health law and policy in the areas of Medicare, Medicaid, CHIP, long-term care financing and delivery, and delivery system reform, and assure alignment of data needs with policy development; Write and edit a variety of documents ranging from detailed reports and policy briefs to memoranda, blog posts, and op-eds; Track and analyze relevant government and policy documents, including legislation, regulations, other agency guidance, and academic and policy research to inform policymaking; Participate as part of a team to develop policy options, identify and conduct outreach to health policy stakeholders including states, health care providers, health insurers, consumer organizations, academic researchers, and other health policy experts; and Brief and provide technical assistance to external stakeholders, including congressional and agency staff in partnership with the Bipartisan Policy Center Advocacy Network, as well as internal and other external audiences. Qualifications Strong quantitative background required including extensive experience with spreadsheet-based analysis A basic understanding of statistics required, and experience with statistical packages (SPSS, SAS, etc.) a plus 3-5 years of experience in health care policy or health economic and budget policy Strong research and writing skills Ability to multi-task, work as part of a team, and produce documents quickly and efficiently Familiarity with congressional and regulatory processes, the federal budget process, and congressional agencies such as CBO, GAO, MACPAC, and MedPAC, and the ability to find and analyze congressional and federal agency documents Advanced degree required, including a master’s degree in health policy, public policy, health administration, public health, economic policy, or related field BPC values interaction and collaboration across its departments and policy projects. Periodically there may be opportunities to contribute to new or expanding projects in other policy or functional areas. BPC offers a highly competitive salary and provides generous benefits. Individuals interested in this position should send resume, cover letter, writing sample, and references to jobs@bipartisanpolicy.org . Please be sure to include the title of this job, Senior Policy Analyst, Health Project Data Analysis , in the subject line of your email. BPC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Comments are closed. title: Technical Research Analyst (Sustainability)
summary: Resolve issues with data or reporting process to improve data quality. Since 1989, BCS has been providing dynamic management consulting services to federal and...
post_text: Recruit Wizard 16024DC Technical Research Analyst ? Help Please fill in the information below and use the navigational buttons to continue. Warning: Using your browser's Back and Forward buttons may produce undesirable results. Technical Research Analyst Posting Number: 16024DC Help us provide the solutions that will make a difference. If you’re willing to take on challenging and diverse assignments with a commitment to performance and quality, then BCS, Incorporated wants you to join its team! Since 1989, BCS has been providing dynamic management consulting services to federal and state government agencies and private-sector organizations in the clean energy, environmental systems, health and nutrition, and homeland security sectors. Our award-winning services include analysis, business management, communications, information technology, and science and engineering. Learn more about our company and the exciting opportunities we have to offer by visiting the BCS website . Position Location: Washington, D.C. Position Description: BCS, Incorporated is seeking an individual to join its team working with clients at the Department of Energy’s Office of Management (DOE/MA) BCS provides technical, analytical and communications support to The U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE’s) Sustainability Performance Office (SPO). All federal agencies set goals and work towards meeting their sustainability targets for saving energy and water, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, and reducing waste. SPO oversees departmental sustainability efforts required by Executive Orders 13693, 13432, and other related Executive Orders, Federal laws and regulations. Candidates should have environmental science or sustainability background and excellent analytical and communication skills. An ideal candidate would have experience in or be familiar with federal operational sustainability performance tracking, data collection and management, conducting sustainability analyses, and development of sustainability performance reports. Candidates must have a professional attitude, strong attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, and proficiency with Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Responsibilities: As a member of the BCS team, the Analyst will provide technical research, evaluation, analysis, and related communications support for federal clients at DOE/MA. The candidate will assist in the following activities in support of the sustainability performance tracking and reporting: · GHG Inventory Management : Coordinate the collection, analysis, and aggregation of DOE site data through Consolidated Energy Data Report (Excel tool) and Sustainability Dashboard (SQL database) for reporting requirements, including FEMP Workbook, Annual Energy Report, and OMB Scorecards. Update reporting tools based on updated guidance, changes in accounting process, and requirements. Conduct QA/QC of all data calculations. · Sustainability Dashboard Development : Support development and enhancement of the SQL database Dashboard for sustainability reporting. · Miscellaneous Analysis and Support : Resolve issues with data or reporting process to improve data quality. Create reports, presentations, and analyses, as needed. · Strategic Sustainability Performance Plan (SSPP) Development: Coordinate the development of the SSPP by aggregating current site-level sustainability initiatives implemented across the DOE complex and forming future initiatives for the Department to implement that will positively impact goal performance. · Site Sustainability Plan (SSP) and Composite Sustainability Plan (CSP) Support : Update guidance materials for SSP and CSP development and the review and feedback process of plans for sites and programs. Qualifications: B.S. degree in environmental engineering, biology, chemistry or related fields. M.S. degree is a plus. Knowledge of federal sustainability performance tracking and reporting, greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions accounting, renewable energy, energy and water conservation, and alternative fuel use are required. Knowledge of sustainable buildings, fleet management, water use efficiency and management, pollution prevention and waste reduction, and climate change are a plus. 3+ years of relevant work experience is required. Experience working with a federal government agency and knowledge of government processes is a plus. In addition, candidates should have 3+ years of relevant work experience demonstrating: Strong technical research and analytical skills. Strong communication, writing, editing, and presentation development skills. · Self-starter and ability to work both independently and as part of a highly dynamic collaborative team. · Creative and entrepreneurial; a track record of creating and implementing new initiatives and processes. · Advanced skills in use of Excel and development and maintenance of databases and dashboards. To Apply: To apply for this position follow this link to Recruit Wizard. Please include your cover letter in the same file as your resume and complete the online questionnaire: https://home.eease.adp.com/recruit/?id=15208611 Please do not email your resume directly to BCS. Candidate resumes that do not specifically address the position requirements and those not meeting desired experience and qualifications will not be considered. If this employer is a federal contractor subject to the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, 38 U.S.C. 4212 (VEVRAAA), it is required to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans; (2) Recently separated veterans; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veterans; and (4) Armed Forces service medal veterans. How will this information be used? If this employer is a government contractor subject to VEVRAA, this information will be used to measure the effectiveness of its outreach and positive recruitment efforts it undertakes pursuant to VEVRAA. This information is being requested on a voluntary basis and will be kept confidential as required by law. Refusal to provide the requested information will not subject you to any adverse treatment. If provided, this information will not be used in a manner inconsistent with VEVRAA. What is a Protected Veteran? Disabled Veteran: (a) A veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or (b) A person discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. Recently Separated Veteran: Any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran''s discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran: A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. Armed Forces Service Medal Veterans: A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to the Executive Order 12985. USAJobs - Job Announcement Skip to main content Skip to footer site map Toggle Menu Home Search Jobs Basic Search Advanced Search Map Search (BETA) My Account My Account - Main Page Profile Resumes Saved Searches Inbox Saved Jobs Saved Documents Application Status Resource Center Resource Center - Main Page Supplemental Forms Individuals with Disabilities Veterans Students and Recent Graduates Senior Executives Spotlights FAQs Support Sign In | Create an Account Refine Your Search Keyword: Keyword: Job Title, Skills, Agency (etc) Keyword Tips Location: Location: City, State, ZIP Code, or Country Search Advanced Search Back to Search results Education Research Analyst, GS-1730-13 Interior, Bureau of Indian Affairs Agency contact information 1 vacancy in the following location: Washington DC, DC Work Schedule is Full Time - Permanent Opened Friday 4/15/2016 (3 day(s) ago) Closes Friday 4/29/2016 (11 day(s) away) Salary Range $92,145.00 to $119,794.00 / Per Year Series & Grade GS-1730-13/13 Supervisory Status No Who May Apply Bureau Wide/Indian Preference Eligibles/Current Status or Former Career Status Federal Employees with Reinstatement Eligibility/VEOA Eligibles Control Number 436017800 Job Announcement Number BIE-HR 16/97 (1680886) Apply Print Share Save Job Overview Job Overview Summary NOTE: This position is not covered by the bargaining unit. EDUCATION RESEARCH ANALYST, GS-1730-13 Bureau of Indian Education, Washington, DC The Bureau of Indian Education's mission is to provide quality education opportunities from early childhood through life in accordance with the tribes’ needs for cultural and economic well-being and in keeping with the wide diversity of Indian tribes and Alaska Native villages as distinct cultural and governmental entities. The incumbent contributes to the mission of this office an is responsible for professional education research work. The incumbent possesses knowledge of and skill in applying research principles and methods and a broad and thorough knowledge of one or more scientific fields or interdisciplinary areas related to the education research work being performed. INDIAN PREFERENCE: Preference in filling vacancies is given to qualified Indian candidates in accordance with the Indian Preference Act of 1934 (Title 25, USC, Section 472). Verification Form BIA-4432 must be submitted with the application if claiming Indian Preference. Indian preference eligibles that are not currently employed in the Federal service will be appointed under the Excepted Service Appointment Authority Schedule A, 213.3112(A)(7). STATUS CANDIDATES: Consideration will be given to Non-Indian applicants (Status or Reinstatement eligibles) in the absence of a qualified Indian Preference eligible.  Applicants not entitled to Indian or Veteran’s Preference must be Federal civilian employees with competitive status or former Federal civilian employees with reinstatement eligibility and must submit latest Notification of Personnel Action, SF-50B, as proof. VETERANS EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES ACT (VEOA) : Preference eligibles may apply for permanent positions (career or career-conditional appointments) under merit promotion procedures for VEOA appointments; however, veteran’s preference is not a factor in these appointments. To be eligible for a VEOA appointment, a veteran must be a preference eligible OR veteran separated after 3 or more years of continuous active service performed under honorable conditions. Applicants must submit a copy of their DD-214 (Member Copy 4) for verification of eligibility. For more information about this program and to determine whether you are eligible, click here . FORMER FEDERAL EMPLOYEES: Former Federal Employees are required to indicate whether they received a Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment (VSIP) buyout in their previous employment with the Federal government, and are required to submit a copy of the applicable Notification of Personnel Action (SF-50) regarding the VSIP. The majority of individuals, who accept reemployment with the Federal government within 5 years of receiving the VSIP amount, must repay the gross amount of the separation pay prior to reemployment. Duties · Provide leadership to research operations and serve as analyst and manager of data collections and databases for use in developing required reports, documents, and other publications related to student achievement and other measures, including Government Performance and Results Act (GPRA) standards. · Develop data elements of research plans and relevant strategies that utilize valid statistical and mathematical concepts, models, and simulations; develop and validate computerized statistical and mathematical methodologies to measure program specific objectives; conduct tests to verify the adequacy of chosen concepts and techniques to ensure consistency, accuracy, and currency of information to meet project requirements. · Identify appropriate research methodologies and data resource requirements; comply, analyze, and document research findings for internal discussion and internal review; and review and recommend action in relation to key research findings consistent with educational priorities of the BIE. · Develop project reports for distribution on a regular or ad-hoc basis to internal BIE and external stakeholders including Central Office staff, Education Resource Centers (ERC) staff, schools, collaborative researchers, and the general public, U.S. Department of the Interior, and the U.S. Department of Education. · Identify precise operational definitions of the data elements, data sources, and reporting formats for various performance management and accountability requirements; identify the most appropriate information databases and collection systems to be sourced for development of educational performance measures, indicators and performance reports; use various data bases to ensure that the required data for performance measures and other accountability mechanisms is available, accessible, meets standards and is synchronized with reporting requirements; identify and develop the data sources needed to fulfill various specific education accountability mechanisms and reporting requirements. · Consult with BIE Central Office, ERC offices, school representatives, parents, tribal entities, and other stakeholders on issues regarding student performance information. · Establish and maintain a data quality inspection plan to ensure the quality (i.e., accuracy, completeness, timeliness) of data within the BIE; assist in the establishment of data verification and validation procedures and reports. Travel Required Occasional Travel Work requires travel away from the duty station on field assignments. Travel involves transit via airplane and motor vehicle Relocation Authorized Yes Travel and relocation expenses will be authorized in accordance with the Federal Travel Regulations, with the exception of real estate expenses under the contractor-provided home sale contract. Job Requirements Job Requirements Key Requirements US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED BACKGROUND SECURITY INVESTIGATION REQUIRED FOR ALL HIRES APPLICATIONS ARE ONLY ACCEPTED ONLINE OR BY FAX TRAVEL AND RELOCATION EXPENSES WILL BE PAID VALID STATE DRIVER'S LICENSE IS REQUIRED DECLARATION FOR FEDERAL EMPLOYMENT (OF306) REQ'D AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION APPOINTMENT MAY BE SUBJECT TO A 1 YEAR PROBATIONARY PERIOD Qualifications Applicants must meet
the qualification requirements contained in the OPM Standards . For this position, they are listed below. BASIC REQUIREMENTS: A. Degree:
that included or was supplemented by at least 24 semester hours in a field
related to the work of the position to be filled, of which at least one course
was in research methods and at least two courses were in statistics. OR B. Combination
of education and experience -- at least 24 semester hours in a field related to
the work of the position to be filled, including at least one course in
research methods and two courses in statistics, plus appropriate experience or
additional education. The experience must have demonstrated (1) a thorough
knowledge of the principles underlying the work of this series, and (2)
understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the methods and techniques
applied in performing work in this series. In addition to meeting the basic requirements listed above, candidates
must have specialized experience as identified below. SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: One year of
specialized experience that equipped the applicant with the particular
knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the
position, and that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be
filled. To be creditable, specialized experience must have been equivalent to
at least the next lower grade level in the Federal Service. For GS-13: 1 year of specialized experience equivalent to at least GS-12
grade level in the Federal Service. Examples of qualifying experience include: serving as an expert analyst
or manager responsible for professional education research work.
Responsibilities include data collection and analysis; design and oversight of
data collection tools; writing of contract scopes of work; proposals and technical
reports; and preparation of data and reposts for publication for approved
projects. Status applicants MUST meet Time-In-Grade requirements and Time after competitive requirements by 11:59 PM EST Friday, April 29, 2016. Applicants are responsible for providing
documentation that the applicable educational provisions have been met. To
qualify based on education you must submit a legible copy of transcripts or
list of college courses with your name, school name, credit or semester hours,
major(s), and a grade-point average or class ranking. Official transcripts are
required upon selection if you qualified based on education. Education must have been obtained from an
accredited or pre-accredited institution recognized by the U.S. Department of
Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Education
completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the above
requirements if you can show that the foreign education is comparable to that
received in an accredited educational institution in the United States. For further information on creditable education
visit: http://www.ed.gov/admins/finaid/accred/index.html http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html SUITABILITY & CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: A background security investigation is required. Appointment is subject to the successful completion of the security investigation and favorable adjudication. Failure to meet these requirements will be grounds for termination. DRIVING REQUIREMENT: Incumbent may be required, as an incidental duty, to operate a government-owned or leased motor vehicle, in the performance of duties, therefore, a valid driver’s license is required. Incumbent must have a safe driving record within the three-year period immediately preceding submittal of GSA Form 3607 and be able to meet the safe driving requirements of the Bureau of Indian Education. Security Clearance Other Additional Information Additional Information What To Expect Next Once the online questionnaire is received you will receive an acknowledgement email that your submission was successful. After a review of your complete application is made you will be notified of your rating and or referral to the hiring official. If further evaluation or interviews are required you will be contacted. BENEFITS Review our benefits Other Information CTAP/ICTAP : Department of the Interior (DOI) Career Transition Assistance Plan ( CTAP ) procedures apply in filling this vacancy. 5 CFR 330, Career Transition Assistance for Surplus and Displaced Federal Employees requires the following order of selection for this position: a) At Bureau option, personnel actions listed in 5 CFR 330.606(b); b) Any well-qualified SSP candidate who applies within the local commuting area (Surplus and displaced employees will be given equal consideration); c) At Bureau option, personnel actions not subject to RPL; d) Qualified RPL candidates in the local commuting area; e) At Bureau discretion, any other former displaced well-qualified DOI employee, e.g. a well-qualified RPL candidate who applies from outside the local commuting area; f) Well-qualified ICTAP applicants in the local commuting area; g) Other outside applicants (other agencies, nonstatus, etc.); h) To be considered well-qualified , a CTAP/ICTAP applicant must meet the basic qualification requirements with a minimum score of 85 on the Assessment Questionnaire. If you are a veteran with preference eligibility and you are claiming 5-points veterans' preference, you must submit a copy of your DD-214 or other proof of eligibility. If you are claiming 10-point veterans' preference, you must also submit an SF-15, "Application for 10-Point Veterans' Preference" plus the proof required by that form. Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered or exempt from Selective Service . The Bureau of Indian Education has determined
that the duties of this position are suitable scheduled, situational and for

Read more Search Jobs and Apply Keyword Category <--- select ---> Administrative Services Computer Programming Data Analytics Part Time Data Collection Project Management Proposal Management Research Statistics Survey View All Public Policy Office Location <--- select ---> Ann Arbor, MI Cambridge, MA Chicago, IL Oakland, CA Princeton, NJ Remote View All Washington, DC Search By Radius Location Maximum Distance Miles <--- Select ---> 5 10 20 40 Enter Zip Code or City, State About 'Statistics' At Mathematica, our statisticians and data scientists support our mission to improve public well-being by bringing the highest standards of quality, objectivity, and excellence to bear on the provision of information collection and analysis to our clients. We are continually seeking qualified statisticians and data scientists of all levels to work in many of our locations. We offer competitive compensation, generous benefits, and on-site office amenities. Our stimulating, team-oriented work environment is unique because Mathematica is employee-owned. Click on the opportunities below to learn more about specific job qualifications. Job Description Senior Survey Statistician Apply Now Position Description Mathematica is a nationally recognized research organization that conducts social policy studies on health care, disability, education, welfare, nutrition, and related topics. Our mission is to improve public well-being by bringing the highest standards of quality, objectivity, and excellence to bear on the work we do for our clients, which include federal, state, and local government agencies, as well as private foundations. We currently have an opening for a senior survey statistician to oversee our statistical design, implementation, and analysis activities for large-scale or complex data collection studies. The senior survey statistician must possess expertise in survey sampling and weighting, strong oral and written communication skills, the ability to work in an interdisciplinary team, and familiarity with statistical software. This position requires strong project and business development leadership skills. We are especially interested in individuals with expertise in RDD and ABS sampling, variance estimation for complex sample survey data, nonresponse bias analysis, imputation, survey research methodology (survey paradata, total survey error, and adaptive survey design), data linkage, data disclosure avoidance, and small area estimation. Our projects use interdisciplinary teams made up of subject matter specialists, statisticians, survey researchers, and software engineers. We offer our employees a stimulating, team-oriented work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package, as well as the advantages of employee ownership. We provide generous paid time off and an on-site fitness center. Position Requirements PhD in statistics or related field plus five years of work experience in statistics including at least three years in a similar work environment. A combination of equivalent education and work experience may be substituted for the above requirements Expertise in sample design and weighting Strong oral and written communication skills Strong project and business development leadership skills Knowledge and/or experience in the areas of survey sampling (including RDD and ABS), weighting, variance estimation for complex sample survey data, imputation, survey research methodology (especially on survey paradata, total survey error, and adaptive survey design), data linkage, and data disclosure avoidance is desirable Knowledge and experience with statistical software Please submit a cover letter and resume and be sure to include your salary requirements.  Also, be prepared to upload your transcripts, contact information for three references, and writing sample. Various federal agencies with whom we contract require that staff successfully undergo a background investigation or security clearance as a condition of working on the project. If you are assigned to such a project, you will be required to obtain the requisite security clearance. Available Locations: Princeton, NJ; Washington, DC; Cambridge, MA; Chicago, IL; Ann Arbor, MI; Oakland, CA We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. title: Forensic Scientist (DNA)
summary: As such, incumbents of this position shall be subject to criminal background checks, background investigations, and mandatory drug and alcohol testing, as...
post_text: DC Government Career Opportunities| dchr Skip to main content dchr Department of Human Resources DC Agency Top Menu DC Government Career Opportunities Careers Return To Job Search Log In Register How To Apply Job Title: Forensic Scientist (DNA) Requisition Number: JO-1603-5136 Grade: 09 Salary Range: $49,551.00 - $63,798.00 Promotion Potential: Yes Agency: Dept of Forensic Sciences Location: 401 E St SW (Consolidated Forensic Lab) Area of Consideration: Open to the Public Opening/Closing Date: 4/4/2016 - 5/4/2016 Share | | Email this job Forensic Science (DNA) CS-401-09 (Union) Career Service Term (Grant Funded Position) Salary Range -  $49,551  -  $63,798 Annually Job Summary This position is located in the Department of Forensic Sciences (DFS). The mission of the DFS is to provide high-quality, timely, accurate, and reliable forensic science services using best practices and best available technology, focusing on unbiased science and transparency, to enhance public safety and health. The position is responsible for basic and limited laboratory work, which includes aspects of casework, accreditation, quality assurance and control programs within the Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL). Performs a variety of operations in a laboratory setting, e.g., basic testing and for casework and accreditation; prepares and maintains detailed records in accordance with laboratory, accreditation and statutory requirements; assists with audit preparation and administration; demonstrates continuous efforts to improve operations; and works cooperatively and jointly to provide seamless customer service. Applies non-routine or specialized and challenging procedures as instructed, and takes corrective action; accepts and resolves referrals of abnormal or unusual specimens; establishes and monitors quality control procedures and coordinates the laboratory program with the overall quality control program of the laboratory. Utilizes experience and/or training to complete work within the Forensic Science Laboratory; and receives comprehensive training in casework examination, sample processing, laboratory decontamination, instrument setup and troubleshooting, equipment maintenance, materials and evidence handling and storage, documentation, and report writing. Utilizes verbal and written instructions to perform various techniques that aids and assists the functions of the Forensic Science Laboratory; and to document and maintain detailed logs and records of materials, reagents, equipment, and instruments . Works with supervisor and/or team leader and other personnel to ensure laboratory and accreditation standards are met. Conducts limited assignments by determining what tests, procedures and methods to use; and may be required to conduct quantitative and qualitative procedures by using specific techniques, including but not limited to physical testing, visual analysis, identification and classification, comparisons, and microscopy. May maintain, calibrate, and modify complex equipment used for a variety of test and evaluation procedures. Participates in a structured training program that pertains to the quality control/quality assurance programs, proficiency testing and safety programs; and attends relevant seminars, lectures and other training and development activities. Utilizes computer software to analyze results of quality and performance checks in order to perform quality control measures and keeps up-to-date on current studies, pamphlets, journals , and books for use in assisting in devising new methods and tests . Projects a professional image while representing the FLS and DFS; and exemplifies Department values, both on and off duty. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Knowledge of and skill and ability gained through work experience or training in applying theories, principles, concepts, methodology and practices of analytical chemistry, physical science, or biology or related field to the work that is sufficient to perform mathematical and statistical analyses that relate to analytical laboratory work. Knowledge of, and ability to apply D.C. and Federal laws, codes and regulations pertaining to forensic science; and the ability to follow training on how to apply ISO 17025 accreditation standards. Knowledge of or experience in quality control procedures and accreditation standards; proper procedures and standard laboratory rules and safety precautions regarding chemicals, toxins and biohazards; and evidence collection and preservation procedures. Knowledge of and experience or classroom training related to equipment and supplies used in a forensic laboratory including specialized scientific equipment, instrumentation and software; current developments, literature and other sources of information related to the assignment; and the ability to solve problems or respond to technical issues in regards to quality control measures. Experience with or the ability to apply theoretical and analytical principles of natural and physical sciences, including organic, inorganic, biochemistry, physical chemistry, and other applicable fields; apply quality methods and techniques used in the forensic laboratory, including laboratory testing procedures. Experience or ability to work with chemicals and biohazards in a safe manner; and the ability to perform a variety of quality and performance checks and analyses; and ability to recognize anomalies, prepare hypotheses, and take appropriate action; prepare and maintain accurate records/data and prepare clear and concise summaries and memoranda. Ability to keep up to date with recent developments, current literature and sources of information related to forensic sciences associated with DNA and the ability to learn how to modify analytical methods, to solve problems or respond to technical issues. Demonstrates the ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing; and maintain effective working relationships. Skill and ability to use a personal computer to apply forensic software applications; and prepare, store, and retrieve data and knowledge of software affiliated with the laboratory. Exercises discretion and sound judgment to determine proper courses of action and assesses and evaluates a variety of situations, problems, conditions or questions. Ability to work safely without presenting a threat to self or others is essential. Licensures, Certifications and other requirements Required to successfully complete competency testing prior to beginning technical work on any equipment or instrument in a specialty discipline or sub-discipline. The nature of the work in the Forensic Science Laboratory requires safe handling and processing of chemicals and reagents within the laboratory, and standard health and safety processes must be constantly demonstrated and reinforced. This position’s duty station will be housed within the Consolidated Forensic Laboratory (CFL) which is a protection-sensitive facility. As such, incumbents of this position shall be subject to criminal background checks, background investigations, and mandatory drug and alcohol testing, as applicable. This position’s duty station will be housed within the Consolidated Forensic Laboratory (CFL) which is a protection-sensitive facility. As such, incumbents of this position shall be subject to criminal background checks, background investigations, and mandatory drug and alcohol testing, as applicable.  Due to the handling of primary evidence, the applicant will be required to submit a buccal swab for the purposes of the DNA Quality Control database for the DFS. The nature of the DFS mission necessarily involves the potential risks associated with biological or chemical hazards, including morgue functions. Although contact with these functions is intended to be minimal, the risks are nevertheless possible; training to recognize, address, and mitigate these risks is required as is dealing with potentially personally difficult topics, such as crime, death, and disease. Education Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in science; or a h igher degree and/or industry certification favorably considered. Work Experience Knowledge of or experience in quality control procedures and accreditation standards; proper procedures and standard laboratory rules and safety precautions regarding chemicals, toxins and biohazards; and evidence collection and preservation procedures. Knowledge of and experience or classroom training related to equipment and supplies used in a forensic laboratory including specialized scientific equipment, instrumentation and software; current developments, literature and other sources of information related to the assignment; and the ability to solve problems or respond to technical issues in regards to quality control measures. Experience with or the ability to apply theoretical and analytical principles of natural and physical sciences, including organic, inorganic, biochemistry, physical chemistry, and other applicable fields; apply quality methods and techniques used in the forensic laboratory, including laboratory testing procedures. Experience or ability to work with chemicals and biohazards in a safe manner; and the ability to perform a variety of quality and performance checks and analyses; and ability to recognize anomalies, prepare hypotheses, and take appropriate action; prepare and maintain accurate records/data and prepare clear and concise summaries and memoranda. Work Environment The work is performed in an office and laboratory . The office setting is when preparing documentation, and the laboratory setting is during the testing and analysis phase . The incumbent may be exposed to hazardous materials, toxic substances, blood borne pathogens, and electric current and electrostatic discharge and is required to follow safe laboratory practices and wear protective clothing, including facial masks, safety glasses, gloves, ear protection , etc. Would you like to apply to this job? Since 1977, we have provided objectivity, smart thinking and the highest levels of support to help our clients get the job done, and done right. Our vast experience and knowledgeable people are our greatest assets. Their subject matter expertise, commitment to excellence and the high quality of their work, combined with our full suite of services, allows our clients to accomplish their missions and support national priorities. Our corporate values are based on integrity, excellence, honesty, service and trust. It is through these values that we form long-term client partnerships, build expertise, and attract and retain talented employees. For more information about MCR, LLC career opportunities, please visit www.mcri.com. DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES Conduct a variety of quantitative analysis and evaluation activities in support of large scale FAA programs related to the implementation, development, and modernization of the National Airspace System (NAS). Tasks may include supporting the development of cost-benefit analysis, risk analysis, data collection, data analysis, simulation model execution, software development,  economic analysis, and operational effectiveness studies.  Twenty  years relevant experience with strong quantitative skills, estimation of FAA and user benefits, and experience across a broad range of domains (communications, navigation, surveillance/air traffic management, and weather) required. Background in aviation and/or air traffic control needed. Strong candidates will be system-type thinker with organizational assessment skills. Candidates should have knowledge of decision analysis applications and possess strong communications skills (both written and verbal) as customer interface is required. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s Degree required. 15+ years of work experience. Knowledge of aviation and/or FAA air traffic control procedures and performance issues Strong quantitative analysis skills and experience with decision analysis applications Provide analytical support to the evaluation of NAS system shortfalls & the development of benefit & operational value estimates in accordance with FAA Acquisition Managements System (AMS guidance Provide modeling capabilities to measure performance impact of NAS modernization projects & to forecast future impacts of such projects Develop system performance metrics System-type thinker, understand the big picture Support  the development of Investment Analysis Plans (IAPs) and Business Case Analysis Reports (BCARs) Modeling, Simulation, queuing theory, operations research coursework or experience Applied Statistics/Math Course work or experience Knowledge of FAA OR Lab tools and databases is a plus Microsoft Office Skills (Excel, Word, Access, PowerPoint) Strong Communications Skills (both writing and verbal) to perform as customer liaison US Citizenship is required.  Applicants selected will be subject to a Government investigation and must meet eligibility requirements to obtain and retain the designated Government clearance (DOT Public Trust). ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS Master’s Degree is preferred EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER MCR, LLC is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Description Job Number: 01210020 Key Role: Support a federal agency's decision making process by developing simulation models and applying advanced analytics and data science techniques. Perform data analysis of budgetary and programmatic information. Participate in the verification and validation of simulations, models, and tools. Apply linear and non-linear optimization tools. Provide independent assessments of studies, analyses, reports, and cost estimates. Apply decision theory and portfolio analysis to inform strategic resourcing decisions and develop stochastic and deterministic models and simulations to support budgetary decisions and POM development. Job Requirements Basic Qualifications: -3+ years of experience with data analytics -Ability to work with large data sets using R, Python, SAS, and JMP -Ability to be self-motivated and enjoy solving problems -Ability to obtain a security clearance -MA or MS degree Additional Qualifications: -Experience in working on the client site with the DoD -Top Secret clearance -MA or MS degree in Operations Research, Applied Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or a related field Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. title: Senior Analytics Coordinator
summary: At least once cycle of experience coordinating analytic work with a team of analysts, data scientists or other highly technical fields;...
post_text: Senior Analytics Coordinator - Washington, District of Columbia, USA - AFL-CIO Jobs Jobs | Login Senior Analytics Coordinator Department: 300 - Political Pay Type: Salary Benefits: Employer paid Employment Type: Temporary The Political Department provides union members with opportunities to make their voices heard in the political arena, informs members about candidates' positions on important working family issues, and conducts nonpartisan voter registration and get-out-the-vote activities. The Senior Analytics Coordinator analyzes campaign and polling data, and works in design, implementation and analysis of experimental results as well as disseminating political intelligence to AFL-CIO staff, affiliates and partners. The Coordinator is responsible for tracking day to day progress by the team of major projects and initiatives around electoral campaigns, analytics research development and campaign strategy. The Senior Analytics Coordinator works under the lead of the Senior Political Strategist. This is a temporary appointment through March 31, 2018. DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES: • Coordinate prioritization of work between analysts, team leads and the political department managers. • Under the direction of the Department Director, or designee, act as Political Department contact to affiliates, state and local federations, and other AFL-CIO departments as it relates to use of analytic products. • Coordinate work between AFL-CIO data consultants/vendors, including development needs, and intra-department processes. • Oversee development of campaign strategy, working to integrate data-driven best practices into campaign planning and tactics. • Prepare and present campaign planning and research to staff, affiliates and partners. • Collaborate on political voter programs and tools with outside organizations. • Train and support analysts in best practices of political targeting and strategy. • Assist in individual analyst development through training and other opportunities for professional growth. • Evaluate, critique, and refine data research products. • Coordinate with the data division on data acquisition, including the acquisition of voter files, membership file maintenance and analysis of membership data. • Present quantitative information clearly and concisely. • Perform other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS: • Demonstrated analytical creativity, problem-solving abilities, and experience with communication via data analysis and visualization; • Familiarity with principles of political targeting, politics and/or political campaigning; • At least once cycle experience implementing the principles of political targeting and optimizing campaign expenditure; • Demonstrated interest in progressive causes – including experience with political campaign(s), labor, government or public interest groups; • At least once cycle of experience coordinating analytic work with a team of analysts, data scientists or other highly technical fields; • Fluency in political data, such as voter files, polling datasets, Census data, and election results; • Robust familiarity with experimental design and statistical techniques for testing significance and interaction of data and results; • Familiarity with several of the following programs: o Database interface and/or programming (SQL, Oracle, etc.) o Statistics (Stata, SPSS, R, etc.) o Mapping (ArcGIS or other) o Other programming or scripting (Bash, Linux/Unix, Python, etc.) • Demonstrated excellent research and writing skills; • Incredibly strong attention to detail; • Experience with Catalist & VAN data and structures and contracts preferred; • High proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Powerpoint; • Must be a self-starter; • Ability to work long and extended hours and under tight deadlines. post_text: Research Analyst  - SBG Technology Solutions Menu About About Message From CEO Leadership Team Corporate Responsibility Our Work Partners Awards Contact Capabilities Program Management Information Technology Training Consulting Security Solutions Customers Air Force Army Army National Guard Defense Threat Reduction Agency Department of Veteran Affairs Navy Secretary of Defense Transportation Security Administration Contract Vehicles Careers Employee Benefits Current Openings Send Your Resume Media News Brochures Social Media Contact Current Openings >> Research Analyst Research Analyst Summary Title: Research Analyst ID: 1335 Location: Washington DC Description SBG Technology Solutions is hiring a Research Analyst to support the advancement and development of US Navy doctrine and strategy in the realm of international engagement and security cooperation. Successful candidates must possess strong analytical skills, defense and US Navy policy knowledge and proven experience in security cooperation development. This position is contingent upon contract award. Responsibilities: Conduct research and strategic analysis for the development of classified and unclassified Maritime strategy and policy documents. Provide primary support for information papers, assessments, and analysis on security cooperation topics. Lead efforts to gather consistent Security Cooperation activities and funding data via Theater Security Cooperation Management Information System (TSCMIS) for analysis and development of future process to evaluate return on investment. Research and analyze relevant DoD, Joint and Navy security cooperation policy and engagements to identify opportunities for increase benefits and efficiencies. Provide feedback support of current security cooperation initiatives. Communicate across DoD for Security Cooperation-related issues and advocacy support,. Qualifications: Minimum of Master’s degree from an accredited university At least 24 semester hours in a combination of operations research, mathematics, probability, statistics, mathematical logic, science or subject-matter courses requiring substantial competence in college-level mathematics or statistics. At least 3 of the 24 semester house must have been in calculus. Minimum five years of Military and DoD experience in Security Cooperation areas to include analysis of National, Joint, DoD and Navy Guidance addressing Security Force Assistance, Maritime Security Cooperation and regional security cooperation engagement. Must possess experience with mathematical modeling methods and DoD electronic databases, including Theater Security Cooperation Management Information System (TSCMIS). Excellent organization and analytical skills. Attention to detail and ability to measure and analyze data in creative ways. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Expert in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word. Previous OPNAV or SECNAV experience is preferred. About SBG Technology Solutions: Founded in 2004, SBG has emerged over the past decade as one of the premiere small government contractors in the nation. SBG provides information technology, training and consulting services to federal government and commercial clients including the Departments of Defense, Homeland Security and Veterans Affairs, Navy, and Army National Guard. SBG is growing continuously, solidifying our reputation as an innovative and reliable partner and excellent place to work and grow a career. SBG’s benefits package includes comprehensive health and dental care, life insurance, industry-leading 401(k) options, 25 days of paid time off per year, schedule flexibility, and telework opportunities. Location: Washington, DC Travel: Less than 25% Schedule: Full-time Salary: Commensurate with experience Required Clearance: Current TS/SCI desired, must be eligible for TS/SCI if not already cleared Potential for Teleworking: No SBG Technology Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of SBG Technology Solutions to afford equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, disability or veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Founded in 2004, SBG provides innovative and cost effective solutions to federal agencies and commercial clients. Over the last eight years SBG has established a diverse client base and a strong portfolio of proven performance and expertise. Contact Information SBG Corporate Headquarters 1000 N. Apply Now Refer Job: Add to Saved Jobs Back Associate All-Source Geospatial Data Scientist About the Company DigitalGlobe is a leading provider of commercial high-resolution earth observation and advanced geospatial solutions that help decision makers better understand our changing planet in order to save lives, resources and time.  Sourced from the world’s leading constellation, our imagery solutions deliver unmatched coverage and capacity to meet our customers’ most demanding mission requirements.   Each day customers in defense and intelligence, public safety, civil agencies, map making and analysis, environmental monitoring, oil and gas exploration, infrastructure management, navigation technology, and providers of location-based services depend on DigitalGlobe data, information, technology and expertise to gain actionable insight.  DigitalGlobe is a public company listed on the NYSE as DGI, and is headquartered in Westminster, Colorado. Summary In a team setting, process, manipulate, and analyze geospatial data to extract knowledge or insights from large amounts of vector and raster data.
    Candidates should draw from the fields of GIS, statistics, machine learning and/or predictive analytics. Analytic findings will be presented to the
    customer in written and oral presentations, as well as be incorporated into finished intelligence products in support of the broader Intelligence Community
    and COCOMs. Responsibilities Utilize ArcGIS, QGIS, and/or Google Earth to assist in visualizing and analyzing geospatial data. Interpret and correlate seemingly unrelated information to determine links and patterns while incorporating the use of automated analysis and
        custom-developed Python tools. Conduct in-depth research using classified and unclassified data sources to locate and analyze available intelligence in support of social media and
        Foundational Intelligence requirements. Review current message traffic related to a specific person or theme. Work with Geospatial personnel to develop quality data inputs for the DigitalGlobe Signature Analyst™ (SA) process, as well as utilize SA for
        geospatial predictive modeling. Job Requirements Must possess and can retain an active TS/SCI clearance. Two to four years of experience as an analyst in military intelligence, a civilian intelligence agency, government organization and/or B.A./B.S. in
        Geography, Political Science, History, or related field. Knowledge of a wide range of research and collection methods and analytical applications in order to support the all-source requirements and to develop
        advanced geospatial analytic assessments for the customer. Must be proficient in ArcMap, QGIS, Python, ArcMap ModelBuilder, Analyst Notebook, TAC,
        Google Earth, and/or Palantir among others intelligence databases. Strong communication and briefing skills; candidate must be able to present and deliver products to diverse audiences when necessary. Travel throughout the continental U.S. on short trips to attend and present at conferences and analytic exchanges will be required. Location: Washington, DC Compensation DigitalGlobe offers a generous compensation package including a competitive salary; choice of medical plan; dental, life, and disability insurance; a
    401(K) plan with competitive company match; paid holidays and paid time off Applicants for this position will be required to take and pass a drug test. ? Send to a Friend Please wait... title: Software Engineer
summary: Knowledge of scientific data identification, reference, citation and provenance a plus. Our staff consists of natural, wildlife, and wetland scientists;...
post_text: Straughan Environmental, Inc.- Software Engineer (Washington, DC) Software Engineer (Washington, DC) Software Engineer Straughan Environmental, Inc. is a successful, rapidly growing, woman-owned business that provides high-quality and cost effective environmental consulting services to a wide variety of clients in the government and private sectors. Straughan is committed to sustainable design . We are experts in environmental planning, design, assessments, and policy. Our staff consists of natural, wildlife, and wetland scientists; geomorphologists; civil and environmental engineers; biologists and botanists; planners; foresters; cultural resource specialists; and GIS and CAD technicians. This combination of technical expertise and an understanding of policy makes Straughan a highly competitive firm and a great place to advance your career. Straughan is currently seeking an experienced Software Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate for this position will work with the U.S. Global Change Research Program National Coordination Office ( USGCRP NCO) in coordinating the development of a data system to integrate information about global change from across the program. The Global Change Information System (GCIS), a product of the U.S.USGCRP NCO, is an open source data system for traceable, sound global change data, information, and products. Designed for use by scientists, decision makers, and the public, the GCIS provides coordinated links to a select group of information products produced, maintained, and disseminated by government agencies and organizations. This information is served through a web front end and a RESTful API service. The Software Engineer will have primary responsibility for software development for GCIS and coordinate contributions from partner organizations. As part of the GCIS team, the Software Engineer with collaborate with the GCIS Technical Lead, Data Manager, and other staff in the USGCRP NCO. The Software Engineer must be a self-starter and must manage time effectively while working on concurrent projects. USGCRP Global Change Information System Key Responsibilities: Performs the primary software development for the maintenance and improvement of GCIS. Maintains and improves the GCIS web frontend, https://data.globalchange.gov. Maintains and implements enhancements to the RESTful API service provided by GCIS. Maintains the underlying Resource Description Framework (RDF) service used by GCIS for semantic web publishing. Maintains and implements design modifications for the GCIS system database. Coordinates the integration of contributions from outside development teams into GCIS. Collaborates with the GCIS team and other USGCRP staff to identify evolving functional requirements for GCIS. Maintains system development schedule and oversee progress to ensure timely delivery, escalating issues when necessary. Basic Qualifications: B.S. degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or scientific/technical related discipline. 5+ years of system development experience. Expert in software engineering methodologies and programming languages including Perl, Python, and JavaScript. Experience with web application frameworks. Experience with version control best practices and tools such as Git (preferred), SVN or Mercurial. Experience with relational database management systems such as PostgreSQL Demonstrated expertise building systems incorporating web services and RESTful protocol APIs Knowledge of Linux-based web server administration and configuration. Excellent communication and coordination skills, including the ability to effectively write and organize technical materials. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with Modern Perl tools, including Mojolicious web framework and CPAN. Familiar with Semantic Web and related technologies (RDF, OWL, SPARQL) Knowledge of scientific data identification, reference, citation and provenance a plus. Experience with database architecture and optimization. Experience with web server architecture, configuration management, and security. EOE/AA Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled This is a full time position Visit Careers at Straughan Environmental, Inc. summary: Internal safety data dashboards and reporting solutions that provide meaningful insight to safety data trends....

Lead Safety Statistical Analyst - 90200495 - Washington Blog Search Jobs Email Me Jobs Current Employees Sign in Why Amtrak Culture Benefits Events Resources Diversity Military Technology Student & Grads Blog Search Jobs Email Me Jobs Current Employees Culture Benefits Events Resources Diversity Military Technology Student & Grads Sign in Search by Keyword Search by Location Email similar jobs to me Join with LinkedIn Join with Facebook Join Now Start Please wait... Share this Job Lead Safety Statistical Analyst - 90200495 - Washington Date: Apr 13, 2016 Location: Washington,  DC, US, 20002 Apply now » Apply now Start apply with LinkedIn Start apply with Facebook Apply Now Start Please wait... Apply now × Apply for Job × × × Enter your email to apply Your success is a train ride away. Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move America’s workforce toward the future. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees. Are you ready to join our team? SUMMARY OF DUTIES: This position provides advanced analytical and reporting services to System Safety and the business lines within Operations with the goal of achieving risk identification, mitigation strategies and/or improved processes to eliminate injuries, hazards and risk in the workplace.  This person will be the go-to data resource for the Safety team. This person will have full understanding of the multiple data sources the team relies on to accomplish their analytical tasks. He/she will be able to translate the safety and business needs into data questions and build queries and reports and dashboards. This position will be responsible for demonstrating Amtrak’s values and leadership philosophy while providing customers with excellent service and meeting performance targets that are driven by and aligned with the Strategic Plan goals in Safety and Security. This role has matrix management relationships with other functional and technical groups within the company to ensure compliance with standards and policies established by Amtrak and regulatory authorities. Such matrix relationships include, but are not limited to Central Reporting, Engineering, Mechanical, and Business lines, etc. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: •Leads the safety analytics team in performing data collection and statistical analyses, creates and maintains internal safety data dashboards and reporting solutions that provide meaningful insight to safety data trends and generate predictions that are actionable. •Reviews and validates safety data to ensure quality, assist and/or provide guidance to remedy quality issues. •Independently develops data specifications and effectively communicate proactive recommendations to senior leadership on how to reduce and/or prevent hazards and/or improve safety performance. •Provides formal data preparation and quantitative analytical summaries for communications, presentations, and ad-hoc reports as needed. •Development and continuous improvement of protocols and statistical analysis plans to support the planning, design and execution of continuous improvement projects that have been identified as key company-wide safety trends or issues. •Identifies best practices through analysis and reviews trends and analyzes information to develop and implement safety plans as needed. •Understands the need and interpretation of quantitative analysis as it relates to behavioral safety analytics. •Maintain documentation and lessons learned, best practices, and quality improvement documentation. •Guides best practices for data acquisition and leads data improvement projects. WORK EXPERIENCE: •Demonstrated experience providing advanced analytical and reporting services. •Ability to build, modify and manipulate complex spreadsheets and databases; perform data extraction, processing, manipulation and analysis. •High attention to detail with proven ability to effectively identify and address data quality issues and ability to develop methods for data validation and verification. •Proficiency in Microsoft Excel including Excel VBA in order to build macros, pivot tables, advanced formulas/functions, the ability to create/manage data templates and dashboards. •Experience with Microsoft SharePoint including creation of lists/document libraries, SharePoint Designer, InfoPath, Nintex workflows, and interfacing with programs such as Excel and Outlook. •Experience with SAP Business Objects with a minimum ability to build customized raw data reports. •Ability to effectively plan, set priorities, and manage many projects simultaneously while working under pressure to meet deadlines. •Ability to effectively facilitate change including development of innovative approaches designed to optimize. •Self-motivated  and  able to work independently. •Effective interface and coordination with stakeholders, including division and department management, supervision and labor as well as regulators, vendors and contractors. PREFERRED WORK EXPERIENCE: •Knowledge of analytical programs such as ACL, SAS JMP, or R; and visual analytical tools such as Tableau, SAS Visual Analytics, Business Objects WEBI or Sharepoint Chart Web Parts •Knowledge in SQL and/or R programming languages •Prior experience utilizing Six-Sigma methodologies. •Strong knowledge of safety regulations, policies and programs; injury prevention programs; personal protective safety equipment. PREFERRED EDUCATION: •Postgraduate degree in  Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science or Physical Sciences COMMUNICATION AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS: •Must have excellent oral and written communication skills SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Yes Requisition ID: 20583 Posting Location(s): Delaware; District of Columbia; Maryland; Pennsylvania; Virginia Personnel Area: DC05 Job Family/Function: Safety & Security Relocation Offered: No Education Requirements: Bachelors Degree Travel Requirements: Up to 25% Employment Experience Requirements: 5 - 7 years of experience Amtrak employees power our progress through their performance. We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job – we want it to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging and rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, competitive pay, benefits that protect you and your family, and a high performance culture that recognizes and values your contributions and helps you reach your career goals. We proudly support and encourage U.S. Veterans to apply for Amtrak job opportunities. All positions require pre-employment background verification, medical review and pre-employment drug screen.  Amtrak is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note that any education requirement listed above may be deemed satisfied if you have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. title: Research Analyst
summary: To apply, please email cover letter with salary requirements and resume in Microsoft Word format to personnel@iif.com ....
post_text: Research Analyst job with The Institute of International Finance | 36693168 Skip to main content Skip to main menu Skip to user menu Jobseekers: Sign in or Create account EMPLOYER SIGN IN Home Advanced Search Job alerts Featured Employers Career advice National Listings Newsletter Top Workplaces EMPLOYER SIGN IN Research Analyst 7 days left Employer The Institute of International Finance Location Washington D.C. Salary Competitive Posted Apr 06, 2016 Closes Apr 25, 2016 Function Analyst , Research , Finance Industry Associations , Financial Services and Banking Career Level Experienced (Non-Manager) Hours Full Time Send Save Apply The Institute of International Finance (IIF) is one of the world’s largest global associations of financial institutions with nearly 500 members in 75 countries. We provide economic and financial analysis to our members, serve as a forum for exchanging views and developing proposals on global regulatory issues; and represent our members from the private financial community in discussions with the public sector on global economic and financial policy issues. The IIF is seeking a recent graduate to be a part of its global macroeconomic research team, which focuses on current issues in the world economy such as the global business cycle, monetary policies in advanced economies, and cross-country emerging markets analysis. The research analyst will be directly involved in the production of IIF publications and research notes. Responsibilities include assisting in the general economic coverage, creating and updating economic databases in Excel, preparing charts and tables, as well as helping to produce reports and presentations. The research analyst will be directly involved in the coverage of Japan. Successful candidates will have at least a Bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics or a related field. We value an outgoing personality with ability and desire to work closely with research colleagues. Strong quantitative and spreadsheet skills are essential. Experience in creating and managing large economic databases in Excel would be highly desirable. Knowledge of time series econometrics, and data providers like Bloomberg, Datastream and Haver would be a plus. Must be fluent in English. Other language skills would be an advantage. This position will become available in May, 2016. To apply, please email cover letter with salary requirements and resume in Microsoft Word format to personnel@iif.com . Applications will be accepted through April 25th. For more information on the IIF please refer to our website at www.iif.com . post_text: Full Stack Developer job - Genesis Global Management Corporation - Washington, DC | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Full Stack Developer Genesis Global Management Corporation - Washington, DC $110,000 a year Must-Haves Experience with Elixir/Ruby/React 2+ years experience with Ruby 2+ years web development experience Who you are Your interest in development extends past coding; you have a passion for products and want to be truly involved in the conception, design and production of them. You have experience working with modern front-end technologies and tooling such as React, Flux, Webpack, Sass or similar. You have experience working on the server-side using Node, Elixir, Ruby on Rails, Python / Django or similar. You might have dabbled in some mobile development, whether that’s through React Native, Phonegap or straight up native code in iOS or Android. You are all about collaboration to make great things. You know that great ideas and products aren’t the result of some eureka moment but are the result of great teamwork and iteration. You have at least 2 years of experience working as developer. What you’ll do As a full-stack developer you’ll have the opportunity to work on a multitude of different verticals and problems, building great products and services that have a lasting impact. More specifically you’ll: - Collaborate with developers and strategists to turn ideas into working products - Build prototypes that articulate propositions and allow us to glean customer insights - Make sense of business objectives and customer needs—and know how and when to make technology choices that balance the two - Develop products and services across web, mobile and connected devices. - Work using tests, pull requests, code reviews and continuous integration to ensure a high level of quality in your code and an excellent end product for consumers. - Use Agile techniques to iteratively ship products in small, self organized teams. - Work on open source projects - Represent at conferences and events Knowing all of these is awesome, some is good, but must know at least one. - Node, Elixir, Ruby on Rails, Python / Django or similar - React, Flux, Webpack, Sass or similar. - Application monitoring with Statsd and Graphite,New Relic or similar - PostgresSQL,Mongodb,MySQL,Redis - Experience with Distributed Systems Nice-To-Haves Experience in mobile development Salary Range $100,000 – $115,000 Performance Bonus $0 – $10,000 Benefits Medical Ins. title: Project Managers (Campaign/Election Services)
summary: We are looking for Project Managers who can manage campaign and data driven projects, develop project management systems and processes, and ensure that we...
post_text: Project Managers (Campaign/Election Services) job - Cambridge Analytica - Washington, DC | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Project Managers (Campaign/Election Services) Cambridge Analytica - Washington, DC $75,000 a year Project Managers needed for top data-driven campaigning service provider The Midtown Group has been retained by the global leader in data-driven campaigning services. They work with both incumbents and challengers in democratic processes in the world’s largest democracies and most competitive political arenas. They combine cutting edge research and the best campaigning minds from across the globe to provide clients with election-winning solutions. This fast growing company has doubled in size in 18 months and is set for a similar expansion in the next year and we are urgently seeking 4 new Project Managers to join their Alexandria office on a full time basis. We are looking for Project Managers who can manage campaign and data driven projects, develop project management systems and processes, and ensure that we deliver services and products to the highest possible standards. Ideal candidates will be comfortable working across the commercial, social and political divisions of the company, coordinating and helping teams to design and deliver profitable, effective and achievable projects internally and for a range of international clients. Those selected will be responsible for managing the delivery of client projects, working with data engineers, data scientists, creative production, digital marketing and other specialist functions, and interacting directly with clients at a senior level. In addition, you will develop management processes and project management tools that can be effectively employed across projects of all sizes, to ensure personnel are responsive to project developments and can deliver effectively. You’ll combine innovative thinking with best practice approaches to help take projects from conception to launch and beyond. In return we can offer you the chance to work on a range unique and rewarding projects with the potential for international travel. Main Duties and Responsibilities: Manage and supervise projects throughout the entire life-cycle (initiation to closeout), providing the leadership element for small, bespoke specialist project teams. Design, develop and implement project management processes to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the organization’s project delivery. Carry out progress reporting, risk management and contractual and financial controls in relation to the project or initiative. Be client facing representative on your allocated projects. Essential Requirements: Educated to degree level or equivalent skills and knowledge Prince 2, APM or equivalent qualified Proven and excellent project management skills with knowledge of project management methodologies and processes Proven experience of successfully managing a range of complex projects in the role of a Project Manager, and utilizing process driven project management methodologies in an Agile environment. Experience in the design and development of program or project initiatives (a minimum of 5 years for the Senior Project Manager role). The ability to create and implement project management processes and structures that will increase the efficacy of project delivery in a rapidly expanding organization. Experience of mentoring and managing others in a project team. Excellent communication, problem solving and analytical skills. Desirable * Experience of working in a data related campaign strategy and communications agency and/or in the delivery of digital client solutions. Compensation: 65K to 80K, DOE. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $75,000.00 /year Local candidates only: Washington, DC Required experience: Proven experience managing complex projects: 2 years Required license or certification: PM related certifications preferred Required education: Bachelor's 8 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to Cambridge Analytica.
