Job Description Position Overview The Senior Statistical Programmer will be a member of the Statistical Programming function in the Biostatistics and Statistical Programming group. The main responsibility of this individual is to develop, QC and document SAS programs to support regulatory submissions, CSRs, publications and other needs. Primary Responsibilities: •Develop, QC and document SAS programs for TLFs, ADaM datasets and data review tools. •Provide input on protocols, SAPs, CSRs, and publications. •Provide input on database design, CRF design, CRF annotation, edit checks, integrated data review plans, and SDTM specifications. •Develop shells for TLFs and ADaM specifications in collaboration with biostatisticians and other clinical development colleagues. •Contribute to the development and implementation of standard programming practices and SOPs. •Provide oversight of statistical programming activities of CROs. Skills/Requirements: •MS in biostatistics or a related field with a minimum of 4 years of SAS programming experience in pharmaceutical industry, or BS in biostatistics or a related field with a minimum of 6 years of SAS programming experience in pharmaceutical industry. •Experience in providing statistical programming support to clinical trials. •Experience supporting NDAs desirable. •Familiarity with FDA and ICH regulations and guidelines. •Knowledge of CDISC standards. •Working knowledge of data management procedures, workflows and software systems. •Proficiency in SAS programming, including SAS/BASE, SAS/STAT, SAS/GRAPH and SAS Macro. •Strong problem-solving skills. •Good written and verbal communication skills. DC Salary : Excellent compensation with benefits + bonus Skills : Ruby, RoR, React, Flux, Python, Django, React, Webpack, Sass, Node, Elixir, Mobile, iOS, Android ROLE DESCRIPTION: We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer to help implement our vision at our corporate headquarters in Washington, DC. The position will report to the Chief Data Scientist, and will require a passion and the drive. As a full-stack developer the work you will be doing will be diverse; from maintaining our Consumer Applications to helping to architect and build green-field products to solve the ever changing needs of the business. It’s your job to be focused on making a successful product, not just a beautiful codebase, working closely with our talented team to do so. WHO YOU ARE: Your interest in development extends past coding; you have a passion for products and want to be truly involved in the conception, design and production of them. You have experience working with modern front-end technologies and tooling such as React, Flux, Webpack, Sass or similar. You have experience working on the server-side using Node, Elixir, Ruby on Rails, Python / Django or similar. You might have dabbled in some mobile development, whether that’s through React Native, Phonegap or straight up native code in iOS or Android. You have at least 2 years of experience working as developer. WHAT YOU’LL DO: As a full-stack developer you’ll have the opportunity to work on a multitude of different verticals and problems, building great products and services that have a lasting impact. More specifically you’ll: Collaborate with developers and strategists to turn ideas into working products - Build prototypes that articulate propositions and allow us to glean customer insights Make sense of business objectives and customer needs Know how and when to make technology choices that balance the two - Develop products and services across web, mobile and connected devices. Work using tests, pull requests, code reviews and continuous integration to ensure a high level of quality in your code and an excellent end product for consumers. Use Agile techniques to iteratively ship products in small, self-organized teams. Work on open source projects Must know at least some of these; Node, Elixir, Ruby on Rails, Python / Django or similar React, Flux, Webpack, Sass or similar. Application monitoring with Statsd and Graphite, New Relic or similar PostgresSQL, Mongodb, MySQL, Redis Experience with Distributed Systems MUST-HAVES REQUIREMENTS: Experience with Elixir/Ruby/React 2+ years of experience with Ruby 2+ years web development experience NICE-TO-HAVES: Some Experience in mobile development ========================================== Please click the Apply Now button below to send your resume. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Research Consultant/Senior Analyst - CEB Compliance & Legal Leadership Council for Midsized Companies (53623) Job Description Research Consultant/Senior Analyst - CEB Compliance & Legal Leadership Council for Midsized Companies - 53623 Description This opening is for the CEB Compliance & Legal Leadership Council, the business unit that serves Heads of Legal and Compliance at midsized companies. This business unit is one of the largest and fastest-growing areas of CEB; a place where innovation and member impact are rewarded and you can see an immediate impact from your work. We are currently seeking a Senior Research Analyst or Research Consultant to join the program to serve General Counsel, Chief Compliance Officers, and their teams – a role depending on demonstrated skills and experience. In this team, the research position is a hybrid including elements of both Advisory and Product Creation roles; for example, research analysts regularly join and lead advisory calls and are involved in driving program metrics such as website utilization, meeting attendance, and benchmarking participation. Responsibilities Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Product Creation • Conducting primary and secondary research to understand the challenges facing legal and compliance executives; dissecting problems using qualitative and quantitative research and analytic skills, inductive and deductive reasoning, abstract thinking, and root-cause analysis. • Leading or contributing to a wide range of products, including but not limited to whitepapers, webinars, in-person workshops resource centers/toolkits, training content, product newsletters, and best practice case studies. • Communicating key product enhancements to commercial teams and partnering with product team leaders to deliver or support commercial training efforts • Partnering with large enterprise research and product teams to execute large-scale research studies, benchmarking initiatives and source best practice case studies where appropriate • Ensuring relevance, freshness, and quality control of member-facing content and tools in the Program’s web channel Advisory and Commercial Enablement • Partner with revenue team on calls, collateral, service plans, etc. to engage customers, diagnose customer needs, align CEB research and services to these needs, and demonstrate the value of membership. • Create and package insights into a scalable format for client consumption (e.g., bespoke emails, whitepapers, tools, and project kick-off webinars). • Provide content training, scripting, and coaching for the revenue team. • Drive engagement and participation with key CEB Compliance & Legal resources and diagnostics. • Provide market feedback to department leadership, and participate in brainstorming and planning for new and/or improved products and services. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree required • Facility with Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) • 2-4 years of experience conducting primary and secondary research utilizing qualitative and quantitative data • At least one year experience in member-facing or Revenue-supporting work (e.g., in an advisory capacity) • At least one year experience managing projects • Must be willing to work out of CEB Headquarters in Arlington, VA Preferred Qualifications: • Excellent communication and project management skills • Demonstrated ability to teach and relay ideas, engage clients and work in a team • Experience communicating complex data through relevant means to senior leaders • Independent contribution and comfort with ambiguity (e.g., self-setting work plans and objectives and managing work processes independently) • Desire to work in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment CEB is a best practice insight and technology company. In partnership with leading organizations around the globe, we develop innovative solutions to drive corporate performance. CEB equips leaders at more than 10,000 companies with the intelligence to effectively manage talent, customers, and operations. CEB is a trusted partner to nearly 90% of the Fortune 500 and FTSE 100, and more than 70% of the Dow Jones Asian Titans. More at cebglobal.com. Known as an innovative growth firm, CEB is hiring experienced professionals and early careerists in locations around the world. Learn more at cebcareers.com. CEB is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. title: Project Managers (Campaign/Election Services)
summary: We are looking for Project Managers who can manage campaign and data driven projects, develop project management systems and processes, and ensure that we...
post_text: Project Managers (Campaign/Election Services) job - Cambridge Analytica - Washington, DC | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Project Managers (Campaign/Election Services) Cambridge Analytica - Washington, DC $75,000 a year Project Managers needed for top data-driven campaigning service provider The Midtown Group has been retained by the global leader in data-driven campaigning services. They work with both incumbents and challengers in democratic processes in the world’s largest democracies and most competitive political arenas. They combine cutting edge research and the best campaigning minds from across the globe to provide clients with election-winning solutions. This fast growing company has doubled in size in 18 months and is set for a similar expansion in the next year and we are urgently seeking 4 new Project Managers to join their Alexandria office on a full time basis. We are looking for Project Managers who can manage campaign and data driven projects, develop project management systems and processes, and ensure that we deliver services and products to the highest possible standards. Ideal candidates will be comfortable working across the commercial, social and political divisions of the company, coordinating and helping teams to design and deliver profitable, effective and achievable projects internally and for a range of international clients. Those selected will be responsible for managing the delivery of client projects, working with data engineers, data scientists, creative production, digital marketing and other specialist functions, and interacting directly with clients at a senior level. In addition, you will develop management processes and project management tools that can be effectively employed across projects of all sizes, to ensure personnel are responsive to project developments and can deliver effectively. You’ll combine innovative thinking with best practice approaches to help take projects from conception to launch and beyond. In return we can offer you the chance to work on a range unique and rewarding projects with the potential for international travel. Main Duties and Responsibilities: Manage and supervise projects throughout the entire life-cycle (initiation to closeout), providing the leadership element for small, bespoke specialist project teams. Design, develop and implement project management processes to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the organization’s project delivery. Carry out progress reporting, risk management and contractual and financial controls in relation to the project or initiative. Be client facing representative on your allocated projects. Essential Requirements: Educated to degree level or equivalent skills and knowledge Prince 2, APM or equivalent qualified Proven and excellent project management skills with knowledge of project management methodologies and processes Proven experience of successfully managing a range of complex projects in the role of a Project Manager, and utilizing process driven project management methodologies in an Agile environment. Experience in the design and development of program or project initiatives (a minimum of 5 years for the Senior Project Manager role). The ability to create and implement project management processes and structures that will increase the efficacy of project delivery in a rapidly expanding organization. Experience of mentoring and managing others in a project team. Excellent communication, problem solving and analytical skills. Desirable * Experience of working in a data related campaign strategy and communications agency and/or in the delivery of digital client solutions. Compensation: 65K to 80K, DOE. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $75,000.00 /year Local candidates only: Washington, DC Required experience: Proven experience managing complex projects: 2 years Required license or certification: PM related certifications preferred Required education: Bachelor's 8 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to Cambridge Analytica. title: Geospatial Analyst
summary: We are seeking to expand our top-notch team of forward thinking engineers, data scientists, and innovators, to help our customers make sense of their data....
post_text: Geospatial Analyst job - BigBear, Inc. - Washington, DC | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Geospatial Analyst BigBear, Inc. - Washington, DC BigBear is an Information Technology enterprise with locations in Northern Virginia and Southern California. Our mission is to enable big data computing and analytics for our customers at a low cost. We leverage capabilities such as machine learning, crowd sourcing, geospatial image processing and Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data processing using our on premise cloud computing technology stack. Our solutions provide a unique offering of products, custom built software and services focused within Big Data Analytics, Geospatial Information Systems (GIS), Visualization and Cloud Computing to our Department of Defense, and Commercial customers. We currently have exciting and challenging career opportunities for talented, motivated individuals who want to be part of a fast growing company. Our Team: Operating as a unified team, with employees who are creative, dynamic, and visionary, drives our mission to success. Each team member provides a unique set of advanced technical skills and trade that contributes to our overall success. We pride our team on having a burning desire to push our technology and solutions to the next level of innovation. To accomplish these goals we advocate hard work, dedication, leadership, and a passion for excellence. Why Us? We are seeking to expand our top-notch team of forward thinking engineers, data scientists, and innovators, to help our customers make sense of their data. We are experiencing rapid growth, with a mission to help our customers find new ways to discover, understand, and visualize information. We will provide you a competitive salary, full benefits, 401(k) with match, flexible hours, unlimited coffee and snacks, and an ownership opportunity in the company as we grow. Job Description: We currently have an immediate position available for a Geospatial Intelligence Analyst to support a large task order for a Department of Defense Intelligence Agency. As a member of our core team, you will have an exciting and challenging opportunity to work with emerging technology and a large collection of data sources, engage with a large team of highly skilled professionals, and enjoy a healthy and friendly workplace. Minimum Requirements: Bachelors or Masters degree in Intelligence, related field, or equivalent experience. Must have Top Secret / SCI Security Clearance. Must have a minimum of 8 years Intelligence Analysis experience in conjunction with a Bachelors degree or Specialized training in intelligence analysis a strong plus. Ability to work independently with minimal oversight. Ability to create high quality finished geospatial intelligence products requiring minimal revisions or modifications. Must have experience using geospatial intelligence analysis tools such as ArcGIS, Analyst Notebook, Google Earth, HOT-R, Image Product Library, Intelink, M3, Palintir, TAC, TripWire, and Webtas. Strong communication and leadership skills. Responsibilities: Conduct research and analysis of data and create finished intelligence products. Populate various databases with results of analytical findings. Disseminate a broad array of intelligence products dealing with subject profiles, networks, facilities and resources. Create Persons of Interest profiles and networks. Provide content management support and software requirements management. Participate Intelligence Systems training activities. Provide product dissemination support. Work at the customer site as part of a large team of Geospatial Data Analysts. Work successfully with internal and external teams. Domestic travel as needed. If you are interested in this immediate opportunity please submit your professional resume. BigBear is an Equal Opportunity Employer Required experience: Intelligence Analysis: 8 years Required education: Bachelor's 3 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to BigBear, Inc..
